page.title: 01THE STIBBINGTON AREA
page.content: This area is very flat but varies considerably in vegetation cover. Much of the land is used for intensive arable farming, some of it has natural deciduous woodland and some has plantations of coniferous trees. There are four villages in the area:Stibbington, Ailsworth, Sutton and Waternewton. The river Nene meanders eastwards through the area and an old railway line also traverses the area beside the river. The south-western corner of the area is cut off from the rest of the block by the major trunk road, the A1. This is an important route for traffic travelling between the northern and southern parts of Britain. Settlement in this area dates back to Roman times and much evidence of early settlements still remains.
